article: Fun & Spicy Truth or Dare Questions to Ask Your Girlfriend
intro: If you’re looking to learn more about your girlfriend and deepen your connection, playing truth or dare is the perfect way to bond as a couple. In this article, we’re providing the ultimate list of truth or dare questions so you can keep the spark alive—even if you’re not in the same room. From funny and creative to flirty and romantic, here’s everything you need to spice up your relationship!

steps.title: Get to know her better with these iconic truth or dare questions.
steps.subtitle: If you’re just playing truth or dare to kill time together, ask some classic questions to improve your connection. Discover your girlfriend’s likes and dislikes, secret skills, and any other random information you’ve been dying to know. It’s a great way to learn more about her as an individual.
sub-points: What’s the #1 thing on your bucket list?
What’s your favorite band?
What’s your biggest pet peeve?
What’s your worst habit?
What’s the last lie you told?
Do you prefer watching TV shows or movies?
Do you believe in aliens?
Do you have any hidden talents?
What was your dream job as a kid?
What’s the most drunk you’ve ever been?
If you won the lottery, what would you buy?
If you could solve one problem in the world, what would it be?
What’s the most embarrassing thing you’ve ever done?
If you were the opposite sex for a day, what would you do?
Have you ever broken the law?

steps.title: Create a fun and lighthearted game by making her laugh out loud.
steps.subtitle: The goal of truth or dare is to have a fun time, so ask your girlfriend some silly questions to  or tension. Whether you talk about something embarrassing, weird, or gross, sharing a laugh is an incredible bonding experience to help you .
sub-points: What gives you the ick?
What’s your biggest irrational fear?
If you could fight any historical figure, who would it be?
Do you pick your nose?
What’s the longest you’ve gone without showering?
Have you ever peed your pants as an adult?
What’s your most useless skill?
What’s the most unnecessary white lie you’ve ever told?
What’s the worst date you’ve ever been on?
Have you ever re-gifted something?
Have you ever used my toothbrush?
What’s the worst time you’ve laughed at something?
What’s the funniest thing you believed in as a child?
When’s the last time you were embarrassed?
What’s the grossest thing you’ve ever done?
What’s an embarrassing song you secretly love?

steps.title: Suggest hypothetical situations to .
steps.subtitle: If you want to catch your girlfriend off guard and pick her brain, ask these “what if” and “would you rather” questions to prompt an engaging discussion. They’re quirky, thought-provoking, and revealing so you can find out the type of person she is.
sub-points: Would you rather explore space or the deep sea?
Would you rather have a pause or rewind button in your life?
Would you rather always have a full phone battery or a full tank of gas?
Would you rather be in jail for 5 years or be in a coma for 10 years?
Would you rather never be able to go out during the day or never be able to go out at night?
Would you rather take back anything you say or hear any conversation that’s about you?
Would you rather have the ability to see 10 minutes into the future or 150 minutes into the future?
Would you rather have everyone be able to read your mind or everyone you know have access to your search history?
If you could live in any fictional world, where are you going?
If you could stay one age forever, what age would you choose?
If you could only eat one meal for the rest of your life, what would it be?
If you could master one skill instantly, what would it be?
If you were born 100 years earlier, what would your occupation be?
If you could create your dream band with 5 solo artists, dead or alive, who would be in it?
If you were an Olympic athlete, what sport would you compete in?

steps.title: Keep the romance alive by asking her some sweet questions.
steps.subtitle: If you want to reveal your soft side, don’t be afraid to  and find out what your girlfriend loves about you. Asking romantic questions can help you determine the best ways to connect with her, maintain her attraction, and .
sub-points: What’s your love language?
Do you believe in soulmates?
Do you believe in love at first sight?
If we had to move to another country, where would we live?
What’s something that reminds you of me?
When was your first kiss?
What attracts you to me?
What’s the first thing you noticed about me?
When did you realize you really liked me?
How did you know that I was into you?
If we had a Netflix series, what would it be called?
How would you approach me if we weren’t dating?
What are your green flags in a relationship?
What’s something I can do to strengthen our relationship?
What’s the craziest thing you’ve ever done for love?
If you could relive one day in our relationship, what would it be?
What’s the biggest age gap you would be comfortable with in a relationship?

sub-points: What’s your love language?
Do you believe in soulmates?
Do you believe in love at first sight?
If we had to move to another country, where would we live?
What’s something that reminds you of me?
When was your first kiss?
What attracts you to me?
What’s the first thing you noticed about me?
When did you realize you really liked me?
How did you know that I was into you?
If we had a Netflix series, what would it be called?
How would you approach me if we weren’t dating?
What are your green flags in a relationship?
What’s something I can do to strengthen our relationship?
What’s the craziest thing you’ve ever done for love?
If you could relive one day in our relationship, what would it be?
What’s the biggest age gap you would be comfortable with in a relationship?

steps.title: Ask about her relationship goals and history to see if you’re compatible.
steps.subtitle: Dive into some serious relationship-related questions to . Discussing her past relationships, expectations, and overall perspective on love can help you figure out what type of partner she is (and see if you two are on the same page). However, be sure to  around what topics are off-limits so you don’t make her feel uncomfortable.
sub-points: How would you define cheating?
Have you ever cheated on someone?
Why did your last relationship end?
How many serious relationships have you been in?
How many times have you been in love?
What’s your definition of love?
How important is sex to you?
Have you ever compared me to an ex?
Do you want kids in the future?
What are your thoughts about marriage?
What would cause you to break up with me?
What’s your biggest fear about our relationship?
Have you ever broken up with someone over text?
What are my best and worst traits as a partner?
What are your boundaries in a relationship?
Am I your usual type?

steps.title: Delve into deeper questions to discover the real her.
steps.subtitle: Trying to  and deepen your relationship? Ask these thought-provoking questions that move beyond the surface. Learning about her values and dreams is one of the best ways to increase intimacy and feel close to your partner. If you’re worried about bringing up personal topics, simply ask her if it’s okay before jumping in.
sub-points: What’s your biggest insecurity?
What’s your greatest fear?
What’s your biggest regret?
What are you most grateful for?
What are 3 things you can work on?
Did you grow up religious?
What are you the most proud of?
When’s the last time you cried?
Who’s your role model?
What’s your favorite childhood memory?
Who did you compare yourself to most often growing up?
Are you more like your mom or dad?
What’s something no one else knows about you?
When’s the last time you stepped out of your comfort zone?
What’s one thing you would do if there were no consequences?

steps.title: Choose fun and playful dares if you’re feeling bored.
steps.subtitle: Trying to liven up your game night? Look no further—these classic dares are tried and true options! Whether you’re playing truth or dare in person or virtually, here are some silly, simple, and iconic dares for a good time:
sub-points: Take a bite out of an onion.
Brush your teeth with peanut butter.
Try to lick your elbow.
Do 100 jumping jacks.
Try to do the worm.
Read the last 5 text messages on your phone.
Show me your search history.
Write your name using your toes.
Wear your clothes inside out for the rest of the game.
Eat a spoonful of the spiciest food in your kitchen.
Tell me your most embarrassing story.
Talk in a British accent for the rest of the game.
Jump in the shower with your clothes on.
Call the last person you texted and howl like a wolf.
Try not to laugh for the next 10 minutes.
Put on as many layers as possible in one minute.
Recite the alphabet with your mouth closed.
Sing all your answers for the rest of the game.

steps.title: Choose a bold and creative dare to challenge your partner.
steps.subtitle: If you’re a close or adventurous couple, up the ante with an intense dare. Some of these options span weeks or months, so they’re great at showing your commitment to your relationship. Plus, they’ll create awesome stories you can tell later on!
sub-points: Give up your phone for the rest of the day.
Give up social media for a week.
Don’t talk for the rest of the day.
Get a matching tattoo with me.
Make me breakfast in bed for one week.
Work out with me for one month.
Let me choose your outfits for a week.
Plan a surprise vacation for me this year.
Text your sister and say you got engaged.
Call your mom and tell her you’re pregnant.
Call my mom and thank her for raising an amazing kid.

sub-points: Give up your phone for the rest of the day.
Give up social media for a week.
Don’t talk for the rest of the day.
Get a matching tattoo with me.
Make me breakfast in bed for one week.
Work out with me for one month.
Let me choose your outfits for a week.
Plan a surprise vacation for me this year.
Text your sister and say you got engaged.
Call your mom and tell her you’re pregnant.
Call my mom and thank her for raising an amazing kid.

steps.title: Let her show you how much she cares with a romantic dare.
steps.subtitle: If you want her to , come up with a heartfelt dare that isn’t sexual. Asking her to create a romantic poem, playlist, or other form of affection is the perfect way to improve intimacy and build emotional attraction in your relationship.
sub-points: Give me a back massage.
Act out your favorite romantic scene with me.
Serenade me with the most romantic song you know.
Demonstrate how you want me to kiss you.
Plan a romantic date for me this weekend.
Write a poem about the part of my body you love most.
Tell me something you’ve never told anyone before.
Declare your love for me on social media.
Give me 5 genuine compliments.
Make me a personalized love playlist.
Freestyle rap about our relationship.
Do an interpretive dance of our relationship.
Write me a love letter to read when I’m alone.
Express your love using sign language.
Describe how our relationship feels without using the word “love.”
